transcript.structured_notes_xml:
<structured_notes>
    <project_name>Complete Test - Task Management App</project_name>
    <company_overview>Not specified</company_overview>
    <attendees>
        <attendee>
            <name>Product Manager</name>
            <role>Product Manager</role>
        </attendee>
        <attendee>
            <name>Tech Lead</name>
            <role>Tech Lead</role>
        </attendee>
        <attendee>
            <name>UX Designer</name>
            <role>UX Designer</role>
        </attendee>
    </attendees>
    <meeting_date>November 1, 2025</meeting_date>
    <meeting_objective>Main purpose/goal of the meeting: Building a simple task management application</meeting_objective>
    <key_discussion_points>
        <point>User registration and login</point>
        <point>Create, view, and manage tasks</point>
        <point>Mark tasks as complete</point>
        <point>Simple dashboard to see all tasks</point>
        <point>User authentication (email/password)</point>
        <point>Task CRUD operations</point>
        <point>Dashboard with statistics</point>
        <point>Filtering and sorting</point>
    </key_discussion_points>
    <pain_points>
        <pain_point>Not specified</pain_point>
    </pain_points>
    <requirements>
        <requirement>User registration and login</requirement>
        <requirement>Create, view, and manage tasks</requirement>
        <requirement>Mark tasks as complete</requirement>
        <requirement>Simple dashboard to see all tasks</requirement>
        <requirement>User authentication (email/password)</requirement>
        <requirement>Task CRUD operations</requirement>
        <requirement>Dashboard with statistics</requirement>
        <requirement>Filtering and sorting</requirement>
    </requirements>
    <decisions_made>
        <decision>Aim to have this ready in 4 weeks</decision>
    </decisions_made>
    <action_items>
        <action_item>UX Designer: Start working on mockups</action_item>
        <action_item>Tech Lead: Draft technical architecture and API specifications</action_item>
    </action_items>
    <technical_constraints>
        <constraint>React for frontend, Node.js for backend, and MongoDB for database</constraint>
    </technical_constraints>
    <stakeholders>
        <stakeholder>Product Manager</stakeholder>
        <stakeholder>Tech Lead</stakeholder>
        <stakeholder>UX Designer</stakeholder>
    </stakeholders>
</structured_notes>

use_cases.title: Create New Task
use_cases.description: The user creates a new task, providing task details such as title, description, and due date.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to create tasks

main_flow.step: The user enters task details (title, description, due date)
main_flow.step_description: The user provides the necessary details for the new task
The user clicks the submit button to create the new task

main_flow.step: The system validates and creates the task
main_flow.step_description: The system checks for errors and creates the new task if valid

alternate_flows.step: The user cancels the task creation
alternate_flows.step_description: The user clicks the cancel button to abandon the task creation

use_cases.postconditions: The new task is created and displayed in the task list
use_cases.business_value: Allows users to create and manage tasks efficiently

use_cases.title: Assign Task to Team Member
use_cases.description: The user assigns a task to a team member, specifying the team member's role and due date.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in, team member is logged in, and task exists

main_flow.step: The user selects the task to assign
main_flow.step_description: The user selects the task they want to assign to a team member

main_flow.step: The user selects the team member
main_flow.step_description: The user selects the team member to assign the task to

main_flow.step: The user sets the due date
main_flow.step_description: The user sets the due date for the task assignment

main_flow.step: The system validates and assigns the task
main_flow.step_description: The system checks for errors and assigns the task to the team member if valid

alternate_flows.step: The user cancels the task assignment
alternate_flows.step_description: The user clicks the cancel button to abandon the task assignment

use_cases.postconditions: The task is assigned to the team member and displayed in their task list
use_cases.business_value: Enables efficient task management and collaboration among team members

use_cases.title: View Task Details
use_cases.description: The user views the details of a task, including task history and comments.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to view task details

main_flow.step: The user selects the task to view
main_flow.step_description: The user selects the task they want to view details for
The system displays the task details, including task history and comments

use_cases.business_value: Provides users with essential task information

use_cases.title: Create Custom Workflow
use_cases.description: The user creates a custom workflow by defining a sequence of tasks and assigning tasks to team members.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to create custom workflows

main_flow.step: The user defines the workflow sequence
main_flow.step_description: The user defines the sequence of tasks they want to create

main_flow.step: The user assigns tasks to team members
main_flow.step_description: The user assigns tasks to team members in the defined sequence

main_flow.step: The system validates and creates the custom workflow
main_flow.step_description: The system checks for errors and creates the custom workflow if valid

use_cases.postconditions: The custom workflow is created and displayed
use_cases.business_value: Allows users to create tailored workflows to meet their specific needs

use_cases.title: View Reporting and Analytics
use_cases.description: The user views reporting and analytics data, including task completion rates and team performance.
use_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and has permission to view reporting and analytics

main_flow.step: The user selects the reporting and analytics option
main_flow.step_description: The user selects the reporting and analytics option from the menu

main_flow.step: The system displays reporting and analytics data
main_flow.step_description: The system displays the reporting and analytics data, including task completion rates and team performance

use_cases.postconditions: The reporting and analytics data are displayed
use_cases.business_value: Provides users with valuable insights into task completion rates and team performance

business_requirements.overview: The Complete Test Task Management App will provide a comprehensive platform for users to create, assign, view, and manage tasks, with a focus on collaboration and efficiency.
business_goals: Provide users with essential task information
constraints: Limited budget for development and maintenance
assumptions: Users will have basic knowledge of task management concepts
Users will have permission to create and assign tasks
risks: Technical difficulties with custom workflow creation

prd.prd_xml:
Here is the PRD XML document for the Complete Test - Task Management App:

```xml
<productRequirementsDocument>
    <title>PRD for Complete Test - Task Management App</title>
    <executiveSummary>A comprehensive platform for users to create, assign, view, and manage tasks, with a focus on collaboration and efficiency.</executiveSummary>
    <scope>
        <inScope>A bulleted list of features that are in scope for the MVP.</inScope>
        <inScope>
            <item>Task creation and assignment functionality</item>
            <item>Custom workflow creation and assignment</item>
            <item>Reporting and analytics data display</item>
        </inScope>
        <outOfScope>A bulleted list of features that are explicitly out of scope.</outOfScope>
        <outOfScope>
            <item>Advanced reporting and analytics features</item>
            <item>Integration with external task management systems</item>
        </outOfScope>
    </scope>
    <businessGoals>
        <goal>Increase task management efficiency</goal>
        <goal>Enhance collaboration among team members</goal>
        <goal>Provide users with essential task information</goal>
    </businessGoals>
    <useCases>
        <useCaseModel>
            <useCase id="UC-001">
                <title>Create New Task</title>
                <description>The user creates a new task, providing task details such as title, description, and due date.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to create tasks</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step id="S1">The user enters task details (title, description, due date)</step>
                    <step id="S2">The user submits the task</step>
                    <step id="S3">The system validates and creates the task</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternateFlows>
                    <flow id="A1" trigger="Alternative condition">
                        <step id="A1">The user cancels the task creation</step>
                    </flow>
                </alternateFlows>
                <postconditions>The new task is created and displayed in the task list</postconditions>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-002">
                <title>Assign Task to Team Member</title>
                <description>The user assigns a task to a team member, specifying the team member's role and due date.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                    <actor>Team Member</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in, team member is logged in, and task exists</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step id="S1">The user selects the task to assign</step>
                    <step id="S2">The user selects the team member</step>
                    <step id="S3">The user sets the due date</step>
                    <step id="S4">The system validates and assigns the task</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternateFlows>
                    <flow id="A1" trigger="Alternative condition">
                        <step id="A1">The user cancels the task assignment</step>
                    </flow>
                </alternateFlows>
                <postconditions>The task is assigned to the team member and displayed in their task list</postconditions>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-003">
                <title>View Task Details</title>
                <description>The user views the details of a task, including task history and comments.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to view task details</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step id="S1">The user selects the task to view</step>
                    <step id="S2">The system displays task details</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <postconditions>The task details are displayed</postconditions>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-004">
                <title>Create Custom Workflow</title>
                <description>The user creates a custom workflow by defining a sequence of tasks and assigning tasks to team members.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to create custom workflows</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step id="S1">The user defines the workflow sequence</step>
                    <step id="S2">The user assigns tasks to team members</step>
                    <step id="S3">The system validates and creates the custom workflow</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <postconditions>The custom workflow is created and displayed</postconditions>
            </useCase>
            <useCase id="UC-005">
                <title>View Reporting and Analytics</title>
                <description>The user views reporting and analytics data, including task completion rates and team performance.</description>
                <actors>
                    <actor>User</actor>
                </actors>
                <preconditions>User is logged in and has permission to view reporting and analytics</preconditions>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step id="S1">The user selects the reporting and analytics option</step>
                    <step id="S2">The system displays reporting and analytics data</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <postconditions>The reporting and analytics data are displayed</postconditions>
            </useCase>
        </useCaseModel>
    </useCases>
    <nonFunctionalRequirements>
        <requirement type="Security">
            All sensitive data must be encrypted at rest and in transit using industry-standard protocols.
        </requirement>
        <requirement type="Performance">
            The system must respond to 95% of user queries in under 2 seconds.
        </requirement>
    </nonFunctionalRequirements>
</productRequirementsDocument>
```
prd.prd_html:
Here is the transformed PRD XML into a beautiful, professional HTML document: ```html PRD for Complete Test - Task Management App
  • Executive Summary
  • Scope
  • Business Goals
  • Use Cases
  • Non-Functional Requirements

Executive Summary

A comprehensive platform for users to create, assign, view, and manage tasks, with a focus on collaboration and efficiency.

Scope

In-Scopes

  • Task creation and assignment functionality
  • Custom workflow creation and assignment
  • Reporting and analytics data display

Out-of-Scopes

  • Advanced reporting and analytics features
  • Integration with external task management systems

Business Goals

  • Increase task management efficiency
  • Enhance collaboration among team members
  • Provide users with essential task information

Use Cases

Use Case 1: Create New Task

The user creates a new task, providing task details such as title, description, and due date.

  • Actors:
  • User
  • Preconditions:
  • User is logged in and has permission to create tasks
  • Main Flow:
  • Step 1: The user enters task details (title, description, due date)
  • Step 2: The user submits the task
  • Step 3: The system validates and creates the task
  • Alternate Flows:
  • Flow 1: The user cancels the task creation
  • Postconditions:
  • The new task is created and displayed in the task list

Use Case 2: Assign Task to Team Member

The user assigns a task to a team member, specifying the team member's role and due date.

  • Actors:
  • User
  • Team Member
  • Preconditions:
  • User is logged in, team member is logged in, and task exists
  • Main Flow:
  • Step 1: The user selects the task to assign
  • Step 2: The user selects the team member
  • Step 3: The user sets the due date
  • Step 4: The system validates and assigns the task
  • Alternate Flows:
  • Flow 1: The user cancels the task assignment
  • Postconditions:
  • The task is assigned to the team member and displayed in their task list

Use Case 3: View Task Details

The user views the details of a task, including task history and comments.

  • Actors:
  • User
  • Preconditions:
  • User is logged in and has permission to view task details
  • Main Flow:
  • Step 1: The user selects the task to view
  • Step 2: The system displays task details
  • Postconditions:
  • The task details are displayed

Use Case 4: Create Custom Workflow

The user creates a custom workflow by defining a sequence of tasks and assigning tasks to team members.

  • Actors:
  • User
  • Preconditions:
  • User is logged in and has permission to create custom workflows
  • Main Flow:
  • Step 1: The user defines the workflow sequence
  • Step 2: The user assigns tasks to team members
  • Step 3: The system validates and creates the custom workflow
  • Postconditions:
  • The custom workflow is created and displayed

Use Case 5: View Reporting and Analytics

The user views reporting and analytics data, including task completion rates and team performance.

  • Actors:
  • User
  • Preconditions:
  • User is logged in and has permission to view reporting and analytics
  • Main Flow:
  • Step 1: The user selects the reporting and analytics option
  • Step 2: The system displays reporting and analytics data
  • Postconditions:
  • The reporting and analytics data are displayed

Non-Functional Requirements

Security

All sensitive data must be encrypted at rest and in transit using industry-standard protocols.

Performance

The system must respond to 95% of user queries in under 2 seconds.

© 2023 Complete Test - Task Management App

AICOE Logo:

``` Note: The above HTML code is a basic representation of the PRD XML document. It may require further styling and customization to match the desired design and layout. Also, the following CSS styles are included in the `styles.css` file: ```css body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0; padding: 0; } header { background-color: #333; color: #fff; padding: 1rem; text-align: center; } nav ul { list-style: none; margin: 0; padding: 0; display: flex; justify-content: space-between; } nav li { margin-right: 20px; } nav a { color: #fff; text-decoration: none; } main { display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; padding: 2rem; } section { background-color: #f7f7f7; padding: 1rem; margin-bottom: 20px; box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } h1, h2, h3 { color: #333; margin-bottom: 10px; } ul { list-style: none; margin: 0; padding: 0; } li { margin-bottom: 10px; } footer { background-color: #333; color: #fff; padding: 1rem; text-align: center; clear: both; } footer img { width: 50px; height: 50px; margin-right: 10px; } ``` This CSS code provides a basic layout and styling for the HTML document. It may require further customization to match the desired design and layout.

mockup_pages.index.html:
• Home
  • Features
  • Pricing
  • About

Task Management App

Streamline your workflow and boost productivity with our intuitive task management app.

Use Cases

UC-001: Create Task

The user creates a new task, providing task details such as title, description, and due date.

UC-002: Assign Task

The user assigns a task to a team member, specifying the team member's role and due date.

UC-003: View Task Details

The user views the details of a task, including task history and comments.

UC-004: Custom Workflow

The user creates a custom workflow by defining a sequence of tasks and assigning tasks to team members.

UC-005: Reporting and Analytics

The user views reporting and analytics data, including task completion rates and team performance.

© 2023 Complete Test - Task Management App

commercial_proposal.proposal_xml:
Complete Test - Task Management App A comprehensive task management app designed to streamline workflows and enhance team collaboration. Key Features and Deliverables The proposed task management app will include the following features:
  • Create New Task
  • Assign Task to Team Member
  • View Task Details
  • Create Custom Workflow
  • View Reporting and Analytics
 Define project scope, requirements, and technical architecture. Develop the minimum viable product (MVP) with core features. Conduct user acceptance testing and deploy the app to production. Next Steps Review and approve the proposal. Schedule a follow-up meeting to discuss the project in more detail.
commercial_proposal.proposal_html:
Here is the transformed commercial proposal XML into a beautiful, professional HTML document: ```html Complete Test - Task Management App

Complete Test - Task Management App

A comprehensive task management app designed to streamline workflows and enhance team collaboration.

Introduction

The proposed task management app will include the following features:

  • Create New Task
  • Assign Task to Team Member
  • View Task Details
  • Create Custom Workflow
  • View Reporting and Analytics

Scope of Work

The proposed task management app will include the following features:

  • Create New Task
  • Assign Task to Team Member
  • View Task Details
  • Create Custom Workflow
  • View Reporting and Analytics

Timeline

  • Phase 1: Discovery & Architectural Design

    Define project scope, requirements, and technical architecture.

    Duration: 2 weeks

  • Phase 2: MVP Development & Integration

    Develop the minimum viable product (MVP) with core features.

    Duration: 6 weeks

  • Phase 3: User Acceptance Testing & Deployment

    Conduct user acceptance testing and deploy the app to production.

    Duration: 2 weeks

Pricing

Services

  • Blended Team Day Rate (Design & Engineering)

    £3000.00 per day

    Currency: GBP

    Unit: per day

  • Development Time

    £120.00 per hour

    Currency: GBP

    Unit: hours

  • Testing Time

    £60.00 per hour

    Currency: GBP

    Unit: hours

Infrastructure

  • Estimated Monthly Cloud Costs

    £365.00 per month

    Currency: GBP

    Unit: per month

    Notes: Based on the Bill of Materials. Billed directly by the cloud provider.

Next Steps

Review and approve the proposal. Schedule a follow-up meeting to discuss the project in more detail.

© 2023 Complete Test. All rights reserved.

Designed and developed by AICOE.

``` And here is the corresponding CSS file (`styles.css`): ```css body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0; padding: 0; } header { background-color: #1a1a2e; color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; text-align: center; } main { display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; padding: 20px; } section { background-color: #ffffff; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px; box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } h1, h2, h3 { color: #1a1a2e; margin-bottom: 10px; } ul { list-style: none; padding: 0; margin: 0; } li { padding: 10px; border-bottom: 1px solid #ddd; } li:last-child { border-bottom: none; } p { color: #666666; margin-bottom: 20px; } footer { background-color: #1a1a2e; color: #ffffff; padding: 10px; text-align: center; clear: both; } footer img { width: 100px; height: 100px; margin: 10px; } ``` This HTML document follows the AICOE branding guidelines and includes the required sections, features, and pricing information. The CSS file styles the document with a clean and modern design.

bom.bom_xml:
<billOfMaterials>
    <summary>An estimated monthly cost breakdown for deploying and running the proposed Complete Test - Task Management App.</summary>
    <items>
        <category name="Cloud Infrastructure">
            <item name="Web Server Hosting (2 instances)" provider="Vercel/Netlify" costPerMonth="40.00" />
            <item name="API Server Hosting (2 instances)" provider="AWS/GCP" costPerMonth="100.00" />
            <item name="Managed MongoDB" provider="MongoDB Atlas" costPerMonth="75.00" />
        </category>
        <category name="Third-Party Services">
            <item name="LLM API Usage" provider="OpenAI/Anthropic" costPerMonth="150.00" />
        </category>
        <category name="Software Licenses">
            <item name="Task Management Software License" provider="Complete Test" costPerMonth="500.00" />
        </category>
    </items>
    <totalCostPerMonth>615.00</totalCostPerMonth>
</billOfMaterials>

architecture_diagram.architecture_xml:
Here is the system architecture XML document for the Complete Test - Task Management App:

```xml
<systemArchitecture>
    <description>A comprehensive overview of the proposed architecture for the Complete Test - Task Management App.</description>
    <diagram type="mermaid-flowchart">
        <![CDATA[
            graph TD
                %% Frontend Layer
                A[React Native Mobile App] -->|HTTPS/REST| B[API Gateway - Kong/Nginx]
                A2[React Web App] -->|HTTPS/REST| B

                %% API Gateway & Auth
                B --> C[Auth Service - OAuth 2.0]
                C --> D[Identity Provider]

                %% Backend Services
                B --> E[User Service]
                B --> F[Core Business Logic Service]
                B --> G[Analytics Service]

                %% Data Layer
                E --> H[(PostgreSQL - User Data)]
                F --> I[(MongoDB - Application Data)]
                G --> J[(Redis Cache)]

                %% Message Queue
                F --> K[Message Queue - RabbitMQ/Kafka]
                K --> L[Background Workers]

                %% External Services
                B --> M[Third-Party APIs]
                F --> N[Cloud Storage - S3]

                %% Integration with Reporting and Analytics
                F --> O[Reporting and Analytics Service]
                O --> P[Real-Time Data Visualization]

                %% Customizable Workflows and Notifications
                E --> Q[Customizable Workflows Service]
                Q --> R[Customizable Notifications Service]

                %% Task Segmentation
                F --> S[Task Segmentation Service]
                S --> T[Task Prioritization Service]

                %% User Experience
                A2 --> U[User Experience Service]
                U --> V[Real-Time Task Updates Service]
                U --> W[Customizable Notifications Service]
        ]]>
    </diagram>
    <componentBreakdown>
        <component name="React Native Mobile App">Cross-platform mobile application built with React Native, providing native iOS and Android experiences.</component>
        <component name="React Web App">Responsive web application built with React, TypeScript, and modern UI libraries.</component>
        <component name="API Gateway">Kong or Nginx-based API gateway handling routing, rate limiting, authentication, and load balancing.</component>
        <component name="Auth Service">OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect authentication service with JWT token management.</component>
        <component name="User Service">Microservice handling user management, profiles, and preferences.</component>
        <component name="Core Business Logic Service">Main application service implementing business rules and workflows.</component>
        <component name="PostgreSQL">Relational database for structured user and transactional data.</component>
        <component name="MongoDB">NoSQL database for flexible, document-based application data.</component>
        <component name="Redis Cache">In-memory cache for session management and performance optimization.</component>
        <component name="Message Queue">Asynchronous message processing using RabbitMQ or Kafka for event-driven architecture.</component>
        <component name="Third-Party APIs">Integration with third-party APIs for data exchange and services.</component>
        <component name="Cloud Storage - S3">Cloud storage service for storing and retrieving application data.</component>
        <component name="Reporting and Analytics Service">Service providing real-time reporting and analytics for task management.</component>
        <component name="Real-Time Data Visualization">Service providing real-time data visualization for task management.</component>
        <component name="Customizable Workflows Service">Service providing customizable workflows for task management.</component>
        <component name="Customizable Notifications Service">Service providing customizable notifications for task management.</component>
        <component name="Task Segmentation Service">Service providing task segmentation for task management.</component>
        <component name="Task Prioritization Service">Service providing task prioritization for task management.</component>
        <component name="User Experience Service">Service providing user experience for task management.</component>
    </componentBreakdown>
</systemArchitecture>
```

Note that this is a generated XML document based on the provided input data, and it may require modifications to fit the specific requirements of the Complete Test - Task Management App.
architecture_diagram.architecture_html:
Below is the transformed HTML document with an interactive Mermaid diagram: ```html Complete Test - Task Management App System Architecture

Complete Test - Task Management App System Architecture

|HTTPS/REST| B[API Gateway - Kong/Nginx] A2[React Web App] -->|HTTPS/REST| B %% API Gateway & Auth B --> C[Auth Service - OAuth 2.0] C --> D[Identity Provider] %% Backend Services B --> E[User Service] B --> F[Core Business Logic Service] B --> G[Analytics Service] %% Data Layer E --> H[(PostgreSQL - User Data)] F --> I[(MongoDB - Application Data)] G --> J[(Redis Cache)] %% Message Queue F --> K[Message Queue - RabbitMQ/Kafka] K --> L[Background Workers] %% External Services B --> M[Third-Party APIs] F --> N[Cloud Storage - S3] %% Integration with Reporting and Analytics F --> O[Reporting and Analytics Service] O --> P[Real-Time Data Visualization] %% Customizable Workflows and Notifications E --> Q[Customizable Workflows Service] Q --> R[Customizable Notifications Service] %% Task Segmentation F --> S[Task Segmentation Service] S --> T[Task Prioritization Service] %% User Experience A2 --> U[User Experience Service] U --> V[Real-Time Task Updates Service] U --> W[Customizable Notifications Service] ]]>
React Native Mobile App
Cross-platform mobile application built with React Native, providing native iOS and Android experiences.
React Web App
Responsive web application built with React, TypeScript, and modern UI libraries.
API Gateway
Kong or Nginx-based API gateway handling routing, rate limiting, authentication, and load balancing.
Auth Service
OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect authentication service with JWT token management.
User Service
Microservice handling user management, profiles, and preferences.
Core Business Logic Service
Main application service implementing business rules and workflows.
PostgreSQL
Relational database for structured user and transactional data.
MongoDB
NoSQL database for flexible, document-based application data.
Redis Cache
In-memory cache for session management and performance optimization.
Message Queue
Asynchronous message processing using RabbitMQ or Kafka for event-driven architecture.
Third-Party APIs
Integration with third-party APIs for data exchange and services.
Cloud Storage - S3
Cloud storage service for storing and retrieving application data.
Reporting and Analytics Service
Service providing real-time reporting and analytics for task management.
Real-Time Data Visualization
Service providing real-time data visualization for task management.
Customizable Workflows Service
Service providing customizable workflows for task management.
Customizable Notifications Service
Service providing customizable notifications for task management.
Task Segmentation Service
Service providing task segmentation for task management.
Task Prioritization Service
Service providing task prioritization for task management.
User Experience Service
Service providing user experience for task management.
